intro: Consolida hispanica subsp. phrygia, commonly known as the Phrygian candytuft, is a flowering plant native to southern Europe and parts of North Africa. It is a member of the Papaveraceae family, characterized by its showy, clustered flowers that range in color from white to pink and purple. The plant typically grows in rocky or dry habitats, often thriving in full sun. Its flowers bloom in spring, and it produces elongated seed pods that release tiny seeds when mature. The subspecies is valued for its ornamental appeal and is sometimes cultivated in gardens for its delicate appearance.
